content: sisterhood of the travelling shirt created by lisa overby the sisterhood of the travelling shirt was designed as a loose fitting one size fits all shirt knit at a loose gauge with yarn twisters finn or yarn inks slub sock this knits up fast looks great on the beach or for a night out ©2023 yarn twisters 1 sisterhood of the travelling shirt materials & info abbreviations yarn for sample 1 2 skeins finn by yarn twisters 420 bobble - bind off yards/115g 100% 17 micron count superwash merino co - cast on sample knit in colourway jones knits approx 150 grams was used for sample k - knit yarn for sample 2 2 skeins sock slub by yarn ink 436 lhn - left hand needle yards/100g 90% sw merino 10% nylon sample knit in colourway malibu approx 150 grams was used for pm place marker sample rhn - right hand needle gauge 16 sts by 24 rnds equal 4 by 4 in stockinette in the round after blocking rli - right lifted increase use your rhn to pick up the st one row below the st on your lhn place st on the needles 6 mm us 10 32 circular needle or size lhn k the st slipping it off your lhn taking care to needed to obtain gauge not slip the original st off your needle notions stitch marker waste yarn darning needle round - round finished size bust circumference 52 sleeve circumference 14 yoke depth 10 length of body st/sts - stitch/stitches from sleeve separation 12 to 13 notes link to picture tutorial of rli https //knotions com/how-to-knit-lifted-increases/ one size fits from a 34 bust to a 48 bust sample 1 finn by yarn twisters 36 bust sample 2 sock slub by yarn ink 36 bust ©2023 yarn twisters 2 sisterhood of the travelling shirt pattern instructions loosely co 120 sts join to k in the round pm to denote the beginning of the round yoke rnds 1 to 18 k round 19 *rli k2* repeat ** to end of round 180 sts rnds 20 to 38 k round 39 *rli k3* repeat ** to end of round 240 sts rnds 40 to 58 k round 59 *rli k4* repeat ** to end of round 300 sts rnds 60 to 70 k 34 bust note measure yoke depth if you would like to make the yoke longer k more rnds until you have reached your desired length sleeve separation remove marker place 50 sts on waste yarn for 1st sleeve using the backwards loop method co 2 sts pm co 2 sts k 100 sts place 50 sts on waste yarn for 2nd sleeve using the backwards loop method co 4 sts k to marker 208 sts on needle for body 50 sts on hold for each sleeve body continue knitting in the round until body reaches desired length sample 1 was knit to 10 before blocking after blocking was 12 sample 2 was knit to 39
